createClient.ProductType.description:
A ProductType relates to how a means of transport "works" in local context.
Example: Even though S-Bahn and U-Bahn in Berlin are both trains, they have different operators, service patterns,
stations and look different. Therefore, they are two distinct products subway and suburban.

createClient.Profile.description:
A profile is a specific customisation for each endpoint.
It parses data from the API differently, add additional information, or enable non-default methods.

createClient.Location.description: A location object is used by other items to indicate their locations.

createClient.Products.description: Each public transportation network exposes its products as boolean properties. See {@link ProductType}

createClient.Station.description:
A station is a larger building or area that can be identified by a name.
It is usually represented by a single node on a public transport map.
Whereas a stop usually specifies a location, a station often is a broader area
that may span across multiple levels or buildings.

createClient.Ids.description: Ids of a Stop, i.e. dhid as 'DELFI Haltestellen ID'

createClient.Stop.description:
A stop is a single small point or structure at which vehicles stop.
A stop always belongs to a station. It may for example be a sign, a basic shelter or a railway platform.

createClient.Region.description: A region is a group of stations, for example a metropolitan area or a geographical or cultural region.

createClient.Route.description: A route represents a single set of stations, of a single line.

createClient.Schedule.description:
There are many ways to format schedules of public transport routes.
This one tries to balance the amount of data and consumability.
It is specifically geared towards urban public transport, with frequent trains and homogenous travels.

createClient.StopOver.description: A stopover represents a vehicle stopping at a stop/station at a specific time.

departure.description: null, if last stopOver of trip

arrival.description: null, if first stopOver of trip

createClient.Trip.description: Trip â€“ a vehicle stopping at a set of stops at specific times

createClient.Journey.description:
A journey is a computed set of directions to get from A to B at a specific time.
It would typically be the result of a route planning algorithm.

departure.description: departure date, undefined corresponds to Date.Now

arrival.description: arrival date, departure and arrival are mutually exclusive.

earlierThan.description: earlierThan, use {@link Journeys#earlierRef}, earlierThan and departure/arrival are mutually exclusive.

laterThan.description: laterThan, use {@link Journeys#laterRef}, laterThan and departure/arrival are mutually exclusive.

transfers.description: Maximum nr of transfers. Default: Let HAFAS decide.

transferTime.description: minimum time for a single transfer in minutes

tickets.description: return tickets? only available with some profiles

polylines.description: return a shape for each leg?

scheduledDays.description: parse which days each journey is valid on

transferTime.description: minimum time for a single transfer in minutes

linesOfStops.description: parse & expose lines at each stop/station?

polyline.description: return a shape for the trip?

linesOfStops.description: parse & expose lines at the stop/station?

when.description: departure date, undefined corresponds to Date.Now

direction.description: only show departures heading to this station

duration.description: show departures for the next n minutes

results.description: max. number of results; `null` means "whatever HAFAS wants"

linesOfStops.description: parse & expose lines at the stop/station?

polylines.description: return a shape for each leg?

tickets.description: return tickets? only available with some profiles

linesOfStops.description: parse & expose lines at each stop/station?

maxDuration.description: maximum travel duration in minutes, pass `null` for infinite

duration.description: compute frames for the next n seconds

polylines.description: return a shape for the trip?

when.description: departure date, undefined corresponds to Date.Now

polylines.description: return leg shapes? (not supported by all endpoints)

journeysFromTrip.description: Retrieves journeys from trip id to station

reachableFrom.description: Retrieves stations reachable within a certain time from a location

radar.description: Retrieves all vehicles currently in an area.

remarks.description: Fetches all remarks known to the HAFAS endpoint

lines.description: Fetches all lines known to the HAFAS endpoint

serverInfo.description: Fetches meta information from the HAFAS endpoint
